channel.title: Garden – Shanti Farm
channel.description: A place of peace and tranquility

item.title: Tomato Seedlings for sale
item.dc:creator: Pam Carlton
item.description:
Now that the weather is getting nice it is time to think about your summer garden. I have several varieties of organically grown tomato seedlings for sale. Some of the varieties include Black Krim, Cherokee Purple, Gold Medal and White…
Read more
item.content:encoded:
Now that the weather is getting nice it is time to think about your summer garden. I have several varieties of organically grown tomato seedlings for sale. Some of the varieties include Black Krim, Cherokee Purple, Gold Medal and White Cherry.

They are $3 per plant in 4″ pot or 4 for $10.  Email me pam@shantifarm.org if you are interested.

There will be more seedlings (peppers, eggplant, beans, cucumbers, basil) coming soon!

item.title: Spring seedlings are available
item.dc:creator: Pam Carlton
item.description:
Happy second day of spring!!  Many of our spring seedlings are ready for you to buy and plant in your gardens.  We have tomatoes, cucumber, basil, cantaloupe and watermelon.  More will be coming soon.  You can see what we have…
Read more
item.content:encoded:
Happy second day of spring!!  Many of our spring seedlings are ready for you to buy and plant in your gardens.  We have tomatoes, cucumber, basil, cantaloupe and watermelon.  More will be coming soon.  You can see what we have on our seedling page.

 

Happy gardening!

item.title: Broccoli, Broccoli and More Broccoli
item.dc:creator: Pam Carlton
item.description:
This morning I realized that I need to harvest more broccoli as it is going to flower.  We have been having it with every meal and just cannot keep up.  We are also keeping our friendsand neighbors supplied with broccoli. …
Read more
item.content:encoded:
This morning I realized that I need to harvest more broccoli as it is going to flower.  We have been having it with every meal and just cannot keep up.  We are also keeping our friendsand neighbors supplied with broccoli.  Next year I need to remember to plant some every couple of weeks and not plant it all at once so the harvest comes more evenly!

This is some of the broccoli I picked today:

Lots of yummy broccoli

Romanesco broccoli looks like a work of art!

This is what I do with the leaves and scraps.

item.title: Planting Chart is up
item.dc:creator: Pam Carlton
item.description:
If you want to know what to plant when in the bay area, check out our planting chart on our Garden Page.  It is from Common Ground which was a wonderful garden store/educational center in Palo Alto.  Our planting chart…
Read more
item.content:encoded: If you want to know what to plant when in the bay area, check out our planting chart on our Garden Page.  It is from Common Ground which was a wonderful garden store/educational center in Palo Alto.  Our planting chart currently has January-March active. I have my Broccoli, Brussels sprout, Kale, Bok Choy, Lettuce and Onion seedlings growing away. What are you going to plant? Please feel free to email me (pam@shantifarm.org) with any questions. Have fun planting!!

item.title: Cauliflower, broccoli and lettuce oh my!
item.dc:creator: Pam Carlton
item.description: The cauliflower, broccoli and lettuce are coming in like crazy!!
item.content:encoded: The cauliflower, broccoli and lettuce are coming in like crazy!!
